himalia.model

Class Poem

  • java.lang.Object
    • himalia.model.Poem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Poem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is for creating poem objects and contains all the functions performed on and by poems.
    Author:
    saadjei
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Poem()
      This is an empty constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Poem

        public Poem()
        This is an empty constructor. Since a row cannot exist without a poem, this constructor creates the empty Poem object to which poems will later be added.

    • Method Detail

      • addInitialRow

        public boolean addInitialRow(Row row)
        This function adds an initial row to the function once it is created. It fails if the poem contains at least on row.
        Parameters:
        row - - The Row object that is used to create initial row of the poem.
        Returns:
        - True if an initial row is created for the poem. False if the poem already has an initial row.

      • getRow

        public Row getRow(int index)
        Return a specific row in the poem, given the row index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the row.
        Returns:
        The row at the give index.

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Get the ID of the poem.
        Returns:
        the id of the current poem.

      • setPosition

        public boolean setPosition(Position newPos)
        Sets the position of the poem, resetting the position of all it's constituent Rows and Words at the same time.
        Parameters:
        newPos - The new position of the poem.
        Returns:
        True if the position is set, false otherwise.

      • setPosition

        public boolean setPosition(int x,
                  int y)
        set the exact position of this poem without changing the row positions.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position to which the poem is set.
        y - The y position to which the poem is set.
        Returns:
        True if the position is set.

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Return the current position of the poem.
        Returns:
        A position object.

      • getRows

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Integer,Row> getRows()
        Return a hash table containing all the rows in a poem.
        Returns:
        The hash table of the rows in the poem.

      • connectEdgeWord

        public boolean connectEdgeWord(Word w)
        Connects an edge word to the poem, given the word.
        Parameters:
        w - The word to be connected to the poem.
        Returns:
        True if the word is properly connected, and False otherwise.

      • disconnectEdgeWord

        public Word disconnectEdgeWord(int rowIndex,
                      int wordIndex)
        Disconnect an edge word from a poem given the index of the row in the poem and the index of the word in the row.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The index of the row from which the word is to be disconnected.
        wordIndex - The the index of the word within the row which is meant to be disconnected.
        Returns:
        This function returns the disconnected word if the word index is valid. Otherwise it returns a null;

      • disconnectEdgeWordAtPoint

        public Word disconnectEdgeWordAtPoint(int x,
                             int y)
        Disconnect an edge word from the poem given a position on the poem..
        Parameters:
        x - The x position at which the word is to be disconnected.
        y - The y position at which the word is to be disconnected.
        Returns:
        The disconnected word.

      • connectBottomRow

        public boolean connectBottomRow(Row row)
        Connects a row to the bottom of the poem and update the ownership of that row.
        Parameters:
        row - The row object which id to be connected to the bottom of the poem.
        Returns:
        True if the connection is successful, False otherwise.

      • connectPoem

        public boolean connectPoem(Poem sourcePoem)
        This function connects two poems, one on top of the other.
        Parameters:
        sourcePoem - The poem to be connected to this target poem.
        Returns:
        True if the connection is successful, False otherwise.

      • connectBottomPoem

        public boolean connectBottomPoem(Poem sourcePoem)
        Connect a poem to the bottom of this poem
        Parameters:
        sourcePoem - The poem to be connected to this target poem.
        Returns:
        True if the connection is successful, False otherwise.

      • connectTopPoem

        public boolean connectTopPoem(Poem sourcePoem,
                     boolean reposition)
        Connect a poem to the top of this poem.
        Parameters:
        sourcePoem - The poem to be connected to this target poem
        reposition - Indicated whether the rows in sourcePoem has to be repositioned.
        Returns:
        True if the connection is successful, False otherwise.

      • getConnectionDirection

        public int getConnectionDirection(Poem sourcePoem)
        Detect the part of this poem that the source poem intersects.
        Parameters:
        sourcePoem - The source poem.
        Returns:
        -1= does not intersect; 0= top; 1= bottom

      • pointIntersects

        public boolean pointIntersects(int x,
                      int y)
        This function returns true if the given point intersects with the poem.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the point.
        y - The y position of the point.
        Returns:
        True if the point intersects the poem, False otherwise.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Poem sourcePoem)
        The function determines whether another poem intersects with this poem.
        Parameters:
        sourcePoem - The source poem.
        Returns:
        True if any rows of the two poems intersect, and false otherwise.

      • getRowFromPoint

        public Row getRowFromPoint(Position pos)
        Return the row in the poem that is intersected by the point.
        Parameters:
        pos - The point at which the row is found.
        Returns:
        The row that intersects the position.

      • getRowIndexFromPoint

        public int getRowIndexFromPoint(Position pos)
        Return the row index of the row in the poem.
        Parameters:
        pos - Any position on the row whose index is being sort.
        Returns:
        The row index. -1 if the point does not intersect any of the rows in the poem.

      • shiftRow

        public boolean shiftRow(Position srcPos,
               Position destPos)
        Shifts a given row in the poem from one location to another within the poem.
        Parameters:
        srcPos - The source position.
        destPos - The destination position.
        Returns:
        True if the row is shifted, and false otherwise.

      • disconnectPoem

        public java.util.ArrayList<Poem> disconnectPoem(Position pos)
        Disconnect a row from a given poem and return the resulting poems.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of this poem from which a the disconnection takes place.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of poems resulting from the disconnection.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Position p)
        Detects whether a position object intercepts a poem.
        Parameters:
        p - The position which is being tested.
        Returns:
        true if the position intersects a point.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Word word)
        Detects whether the poem intersects a given word.
        Parameters:
        word - The word being tested.
        Returns:
        True implies that the poem intersects the word.

      • getIntesectedWord

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> getIntesectedWord(int x,
                                                      int y)
        Get the list of objects that intersect with this poem as a given position.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the point being tested.
        y - The y position of the point being tested.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of objects: Poems, Rows, Words.

      • disconnectPoemFromRowIndex

        public Poem disconnectPoemFromRowIndex(int rowIndex,
                              boolean fromTop)
        Disconnect all the rows that begin at rowIndex of this poem and create a poem with the disconnected rows.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        fromTop - Boolean representing whether a disconnection if from the top or not.
        Returns:
        The poem that results from the disconnection.
